content: The calendar says the meeting for https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues/488 will happen "on Zulip" but has no further details. Where do I have to look to read along and participate? :D
#t-compiler/meetings is the right stream
ah, just found that one. this would be really useful to put into the calendar and https://rust-lang.github.io/compiler-team/ ^^

RalfJ said:

ah, just found that one. this would be really useful to put into the calendar and https://rust-lang.github.io/compiler-team/ ^^

but, it does say that, in https://rust-lang.github.io/compiler-team/#meeting-calendar ?
(or was that text added in the last week...)
(To be clear: I'm trying to figure out how we could have made this clearer. I do see that the calendar event itself should be updated.)

pnkfelix said:

(or was that text added in the last week...)

ha ha ha, it was, oh, thank you for fixing that @RalfJ !
yeah I figured this is an easy first step ;)
starting at https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues/488 it is still a bit unclear how one would figure out where to be to participate in the meeting

that's fair. Maybe when a meeting is scheduled, we should just go ahead and open the zulip topic for it immediately, and then link to it from the github issue. (But I also don't want the zulip topic to have a bunch of discussion ahead of time ...; I think the fact that these meeting topics tend to represent an hour's worth of discussion, at most, is a feature, not a bug.
maybe we could link to the stream or an "index" topic in the stream that just describes how the meetings are organised (read-only to avoid discussions if that's possible)
